availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Curtis A. Brasher (Christian County, Kentucky, farmer and 2nd lieutenant in 17th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.))

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Jacob C. Brasher and Agnes Brasher. Resident of Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant and second lieutenant from December 31, 1861, to January 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, p. 480A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 591.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 299.
Find A Grave, "Curtis A. Brasher (1842-1928)," Memorial #88316135, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88316135 (accessed November 30, 2020).
